div.p: Guidance on interpreting the table can be found here.

span.title:
Sponsor's study ID
A unique identifier for a study.
The corresponding CDASH Variable(s) map directly to identified SDTM Variable(s). I the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.

tr.td: AdverseEvent.researchSubject

Mapping is based on presumption that research subject will be tied to site-specific ResearchStudy, which will then be part of overall ResearchStudy.
The direct path using AdverseEvent.study will only exist if the system maintaining the AdverseEvent is aware of its relevance to the Study.

span.title:
Sponsor's site ID
A unique identifier for a site within a study.
The corresponding CDASH Variable(s) map directly to identified SDTM Variable(s).

tr.td: ResearchStudy.site

Mapping is based on presumption that research subject will be tied to site-specific ResearchStudy, which will then be part of overall ResearchStudy.
The direct path using AdverseEvent.study will only exist if the system maintaining the AdverseEvent is aware of its relevance to the Study.

span.title:
Sponsor's subject Identifier for the study.
A unique subject identifier within a site and a study.
The corresponding CDASH Variable(s) map directly to identified SDTM Variable(s).

tr.td: ResearchSubject.identifier

Study subject is found by finding the StudySubject that corresponds to the same Patient and ResearchStudy as the AdverseEvent.
No standard way to decide which subject identifier to use

span.title:
Any AdverseEvent
An indication whether or not any AEs were experienced during the study.
Does not map to an SDTMIG variable. The SDTM aCRF is annotated to indicate that the field is NOT SUBMITTED.

tr.td: In FHIR, this would be determined by searching for AdverseEvents with a given subject (possibly also filtered by research study) and excluding those that were entered in error. If a flag were necessary, it would be an extension on Study, not sent on AdverseEvent. It might also be necessary to search for Condition instances, Observation instances, Encounters with particular reasons and other resources if the desire is to have the full set of potential adverse reactions.

span.title:
Category for AdverseEvent
A grouping of topic-variable values based on user-defined characteristics.
The corresponding CDASH Variable(s) map directly to identified SDTM Variable(s). I the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.

tr.td: AdverseEvent.category

This is typically sponsor-specific and we would not expect this to come from the site.
In FHIR, an AdverseEvent can be categorized in as many ways as desired with whatever granularity is desired. When converting from FHIR to CDASH, systems will need to look at the FHIR categories (and potentially other information) to determine how best to populate AECAT and AESCAT based on the study-designed categories (unless they've pre-arranged with the EHR to ensure it captures the same codes)

span.title:
Subcategory for AdverseEvent
A sub-division of the AECAT values based on user-defined characteristics.
The corresponding CDASH Variable(s) map directly to identified SDTM Variable(s).

tr.td: AdverseEvent.category

This is typically sponsor-specific and we would not expect this to come from the site.
In FHIR, an AdverseEvent can be categorized in as many ways as desired with whatever granularity is desired. When converting from FHIR to CDASH, systems will need to look at the FHIR categories (and potentially other information) to determine how best to populate AECAT and AESCAT based on the study-designed categories (unless they've pre-arranged with the EHR to ensure it captures the same codes)

span.title:
AE Sponsor-defined Identifier
A sponsor-defined identifier. In CDASH, this is typically used for preprinted or auto generated number on the CRF, or any other type of identifier that does not already have a defined CDASH identifier field.
The corresponding CDASH Variable(s) map directly to identified SDTM Variable(s). May be used to create RELREC to link this record with a record in another domain.

tr.td: AdvserseEvent.identifier
The assigner of the identifier can be explicit or inferred by the Identifier.system.

tr.th: Reported Term for the Adverse Event

span.title:
Reported Term for the Adverse Event.
The reported or prespecified name of the AE.
The corresponding CDASH Variable(s) map directly to identified SDTM Variable(s).

tr.td: AdverseEvent.resultingCondition.Condition

span.title:
AdverseEvent Occurrence
An indication whether a prespecified AdverseEvent or a group of AdverseEvents occurred when information about the occurrence of a specific event is solicited

This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. Because the SDTM AE domain is intended to hold only AdverseEvents that actually happen, all values collected in AEOCCUR for prespecified AEs should be submitted in a Findings About AdverseEvents data set (FAAE) where FAORRES=the value of AEOCCUR where FATESTCD="OCCUR" in addition, where AEOCCUR=Y, there should be a corresponding record in the AE domain.

tr.td: FHIR only captures AdverseEvents that have actually occurred. A flag about whether a particular potential adverse reaction has been detected or not could be captured using Questionnaire Response

span.title: An indication that a specific event, or group of events, are prespecified on a CRF.
The corresponding CDASH Variable(s) map directly to identified SDTM Variable(s).

tr.td: If captured within an EHR, this would be an extension on the existing extension that references the ResearchStudy. (An AdverseEvent might be pre-specified for one study and not for another.)

span.title: The start date of the adverse event, represented in a unambiguous date format (i.e. DD-MON-YYYY)

This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. For the SDTM submission dataset, concatenate all collected CDASH START DATE and TIME components and populate the SDTMIG variable AESTDTC in ISO 8601 format.

tr.td: AdverseEvent.date

span.title: The start time of the adverse event, represented in a unambiguous time format (i.e. hh:mm:ss)

This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. For the SDTM submission dataset, concatenate all collected CDASH START DATE and TIME components and populate the SDTMIG variable AESTDTC in ISO 8601 format.

tr.td: AdverseEvent.date

span.title:
AE Location of Event
Indicates the anatomical location of the adverse event such as ARM.
The corresponding CDASH Variable(s) map directly to identified SDTM Variable(s).

tr.td: AdverseEvent.resultingCondition.bodySite
Requires knowledge or review of data to ensure location, laterality and directionality are included in the code and can be parsed.

span.title:
Qualifier for anatomical location further detailing the side of the body relevant for the event.
Record the side of the anatomical location of the adverse event such as RIGHT or LEFT.
The corresponding CDASH Variable(s) map directly to identified SDTM Variable(s).

tr.td: AdverseEvent.resultingCondition.bodySite
Requires knowledge or review of data to ensure location, laterality and directionality are included in the code and can be parsed.

span.title:
Qualifier for further detailing the position of the anatomical location relative to the center of the body, organ or specimen.
Record the directionality of the anatomical location of the adverse event such as ANTERIOR, PROXIMAL.
The corresponding CDASH Variable(s) map directly to identified SDTM Variable(s).

tr.td: AdverseEvent.resultingCondition.bodySite
Requires knowledge or review of data to ensure location, laterality and directionality are included in the code and can be parsed.

span.title:
Qualifier for anatomical location further detailing the distribution (i.e., arrangement of apportioning of)
Indicate the portion or totality anatomical location of the adverse event.
The corresponding CDASH Variable(s) map directly to identified SDTM Variable(s).

tr.td: AdverseEvent.resultingCondition.bodySite
Review of data to ensure location, laterality and directionality are included in the code and can be parsed.

span.title:
Y/N
Indication that an AdverseEvent is ongoing when no End Date is provided.

tr.td: The concept of ongoing for an AE in the context of CDASH/SDTM is non-existent as it is based on a Y or N flag and an NULL end date indicates the AdverseEvent is ongoing.

span.title: The date when the adverse event resolved/ended, represented in an unambiguous date format (e.g. DD-MON-YYYY)

tr.td: AdverseEvent.extension
Need to use a standard extension to pre-adopt the type allowed in R5. Element contains both date and time (if specified).

span.title: The time when the adverse event ended/resolved, represented in an unambiguous time format (e.g. hh:mm:ss)

tr.td: AdverseEvent.extension
Need to use a standard extension to pre-adopt the type allowed in R5. Element contains both date and time (if specified).

span.title: The severity of intensity of the event.
The corresponding CDASH Variable(s) map directly to identified SDTM Variable(s).

tr.td: AdverseEvent.severity

span.title: The grade of the severity of the event using a standard "toxicity" scale (e.g. NCI CTCAE)

The corresponding CDASH Variable(s) map directly to identified SDTM Variable(s). The sponsor is expected to provide the toxicity scale name and version used to map the terms utilizing the Define-XML external code list attributes.

tr.td: Recommendation is to add extension for oncology or other studies requiring toxicity grades.

span.title:
Y/N An indication whether or not the adverse event is determined to be 'serious" based on what is defined in the protocol.
Access if an adverse event should be classified as serious based on the serious criteria defined in the protocol.
The corresponding CDASH Variable(s) map directly to identified SDTM Variable(s).

tr.td: AdverseEvent.seriousness

span.title: Y/N Record whether the serious adverse event resulted in death
The corresponding CDASH Variable(s) map directly to identified SDTM Variable(s).

tr.td: AdverseEvent.outcome

span.title: Record the date of death
This field does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. For the SDTM dataset, concatenate all collected CDASH DATE and TIME components and populate the SDTM variable DTHDTC in ISO 8601 format.

tr.td: Patient.deceasedDateTime

span.title:
Y?N
An indication the serious adverse event was life threatening
The corresponding CDASH Variable(s) map directly to identified SDTM Variable(s).

tr.td: AdverseEvent.seriousness
These would typically be flagged by seriousness or outcome codes. Will need to propose change request to support capturing more than one

span.title: An indication the serious AdverseEvent resulted in an initial or prolonged hospitalization.
The corresponding CDASH Variable(s) map directly to identified SDTM Variable(s).

tr.td: Note: there is Encounter.hospitalization.[x], but its relevance to AESHOSP may not be explicit and would require additional analysis.

span.title:
Y/N
An indication the serious adverse evet was associated with a persistent or significant disability or incapacity
The corresponding CDASH Variable(s) map directly to identified SDTM Variable(s).

tr.td: AdverseEvent.outcome
These would typically be flagged by seriousness or outcome codes. Will need to propose change request to support capturing more than one

span.title:
Y/N
An indication the serious adverse event was associated with a congenital anomaly or birth defect
The corresponding CDASH Variable(s) map directly to identified SDTM Variable(s).

tr.td: AdverseEvent.outcome
These would typically be flagged by seriousness or outcome codes. Will need to propose change request to support capturing more than one

span.title:
Y/N
An indication an adverse event required medical or surgical intervention to preclude permanent impairment of a body function, or prevent permanent damage to a body structure, due to the use of a medical product.
If the details regarding Serious As are collected I the clinical database, then it is recommended that a separate Yes/No variable be defined for each Serious AE type.

tr.td: AdverseEvent.outcome
These would typically be flagged by seriousness or outcome codes. Will need to propose change request to support capturing more than one

span.title: An indication additional categories for seriousness apply.
The corresponding CDASH Variable(s) map directly to identified SDTM Variable(s).

tr.td: AdverseEvent.outcome
Additional outcomes or seriousness codes would be specified

span.title: An indication the serious event was associated with the development of cancer.
The corresponding CDASH Variable(s) map directly to identified SDTM Variable(s).

tr.td: AdverseEvent.outcome
Additional outcomes or seriousness codes would be specified

span.title:
Y/N
An indication the serious event occurred with an overdose
The corresponding CDASH Variable(s) map directly to identified SDTM Variable(s).

tr.td: AdverseEvent.causality.productRelatedness

Product Relatedness implies that the product is involved in the AE, but it doesn't indicate overdose. After looking through other fields, it does not look like there is a field that would cover this situation. In studies, OD would be a reason why the AE was marked as an SAE.

span.title: An indication the study treatment had a causal effect on the adverse event, as determined by the clinical/investigator
The corresponding CDASH Variable(s) map directly to identified SDTM Variable(s).

tr.td: AdverseEvent.suspectEntity.causality.productRelatedness

span.title: A description of the action taken with study treatment as a result of the event.
The corresponding CDASH Variable(s) map directly to identified SDTM Variable(s).

tr.td: AdverseEvent.extension
Pre-adopting R5 capability via a standard extension. Note that the extension captures all actions taken, so filtration would be needed to select only those related to study treatment

span.title: A description of the action taken with respect to a device used in a study (which may or may not be the device under study) as a result of the event.

This does not map directly an SDTMIG variable. The sponsor may submit this data in a SUPPAE-dataset where SUPPAE.QNAM = "AEACNDEV" and SUPPAE.QLABEL = "Actions Taken with Device". Refer to the current SDTM and SDTMIG for instructions on placement of non-standard variables in SDTM domains.

tr.td: AdverseEvent.extension
Pre-adopting R5 capability via a standard extension. Note that the extension captures all actions taken, so filtration would be needed to select only those related to devices

span.title: A description of other action taken as a result of the event that is unrelated to dose adjustments of the study treatment.
The corresponding CDASH Variable(s) map directly to identified SDTM Variable(s).

tr.td: AdverseEvent.extension
Pre-adopting R5 capability via a standard extension. Note that the extension captures all actions taken, so filtration would be needed to exclude actions related to study treatment or device

span.title: Record the appropriate outcome of the event in relation to the subject's status.
The corresponding CDASH Variable(s) map directly to identified SDTM Variable(s).

tr.td: AdverseEvent.outcome
The coded equivalents matching up the CDISC controlled terminology. Meaning, in the EHR we may not have value-based coordination from FHIR-to-CDISC

span.title:
Y/N
An indication whether the event caused the subject to discontinue from the study.

This does not map directly an SDTMIG variable. May be used to create a RELREC to link the AdverseEvent to the Disposition record (see SDTMIG v3.2 Section (8.2). The sponsor may also submit this data in a SUPPAE dataset where SUPPAE.QNAM = "AEDIS" and SUPPAE.QLABEL = "Cased Study Discontinuation ". if appropriate. Refer to the current SDTM and SDTMIG for instructions on placement of non-standard variables in SDTM domains.

tr.td: Add an extension - would need to be specific to study as relationship might vary by study.

span.title: An indication whether in the investigator's opinion the event may have been due to a treatment other than study treatment
This does not map directly an SDTMIG variable. The SDTM aCRF is annotated to indicate that this field is not SUBMITTED.

tr.td: Add an extension - would need to be specific to study as relationship might vary by study.

span.title: Description of the investigator's opinion as to whether the AdverseEvent may have been due to a treatment other than study treatment
The corresponding CDASH Variable(s) map directly to identified SDTM Variable(s).

tr.td: Add an extension - would need to be specific to study as relationship might vary by study.

span.title: Record the investigator's opinion as to whether the event is an AdverseEvent of special interest by the sponsor.
Does not map to an SDTMIG variable. The SDTM aCRF is annotated to indicate that the field is NOT SUBMITTED.

tr.td: Add extension, probably on a study-specific link. (Adverse events of interst to one study wouldn't necessarily be of interest to others.)

span.title: Used to indicate the pattern of the event over time.
The corresponding CDASH Variable(s) map directly to identified SDTM Variable(s).

tr.td: Add extension

span.title: An indication whether a concomitant or additional treatment given because of the occurrence of the event.
The corresponding CDASH Variable(s) map directly to identified SDTM Variable(s).

tr.td: AdverseEvent.extension
R5 pre-adoption extension. Note that mitigatingActions aren't necessarily treatments, so codes would need to be examined to only map those that were treatments

span.title: If the value for AETERM is modified to facilitate coding, then AEMODIFY will contain the modified text.
The corresponding CDASH Variable(s) map directly to identified SDTM Variable(s).

tr.td: The fact one of the codings was modified would be captured as an extension

span.title: The dictionary or standardized text description of AETERM or the modified topic variable (AEMODIFY), if applicable.
The corresponding CDASH Variable(s) map directly to identified SDTM Variable(s). The sponsor is expected to provide the dictionary name and version used to map the terms.

tr.td: AdverseEvent.resultingCondition.code
Sponsors will populate this through the coding process and is applicable to items using MedDRA coding.

span.title: MedDRA text description of the Lowest Level Term
The corresponding CDASH Variable(s) map directly to identified SDTM Variable(s). The sponsor is expected to provide the dictionary name and version used to map the terms.

tr.td: AdverseEvent.resultingCondition.code
Sponsors will populate this through the coding process and is applicable to items using MedDRA coding.

span.title: MedDRA Lowest Level Term code.
The corresponding CDASH Variable(s) map directly to identified SDTM Variable(s). The sponsor is expected to provide the dictionary name and version used to map the terms.

tr.td: AdverseEvent.resultingCondition.code
Sponsors will populate this through the coding process and is applicable to items using MedDRA coding.

span.title: MedDRA code for the Preferred Term.
The corresponding CDASH Variable(s) map directly to identified SDTM Variable(s). The sponsor is expected to provide the dictionary name and version used to map the terms.

tr.td: AdverseEvent.resultingCondition.code
Sponsors will populate this through the coding process and is applicable to items using MedDRA coding.

span.title: MedDRA text description of the High Level Term from the primary path.
The corresponding CDASH Variable(s) map directly to identified SDTM Variable(s). The sponsor is expected to provide the dictionary name and version used to map the terms.

tr.td: AdverseEvent.resultingCondition.code
Sponsors will populate this through the coding process and is applicable to items using MedDRA coding.

span.title: MedDRA high Level Term code from the primary path.
The corresponding CDASH Variable(s) map directly to identified SDTM Variable(s). The sponsor is expected to provide the dictionary name and version used to map the terms.

tr.td: AdverseEvent.resultingCondition.code
Sponsors will populate this through the coding process and is applicable to items using MedDRA coding.

span.title: MedDRA test description of the High Level Group Term from the primary path.
The corresponding CDASH Variable(s) map directly to identified SDTM Variable(s). The sponsor is expected to provide the dictionary name and version used to map the terms.

tr.td: AdverseEvent.resultingCondition.code
Sponsors will populate this through the coding process and is applicable to items using MedDRA coding.

tr.th: AE High Level Group Term Code

span.title: MedDRA High Level Group Term code from the primary path.
The corresponding CDASH Variable(s) map directly to identified SDTM Variable(s). The sponsor is expected to provide the dictionary name and version used to map the terms.

tr.td: AdverseEvent.resultingCondition.code
Sponsors will populate this through the coding process and is applicable to items using MedDRA coding.

span.title: MedDRA Primary System organ Class text description associated with the event.
The corresponding CDASH Variable(s) map directly to identified SDTM Variable(s). The sponsor is expected to provide the dictionary name and version used to map the terms.

tr.td: AdverseEvent.resultingCondition.code
Sponsors will populate this through the coding process and is applicable to items using MedDRA coding.

tr.th: AE Primary System Organ Class Code

span.title: MedDRA code for the primary System Organ Class.
The corresponding CDASH Variable(s) map directly to identified SDTM Variable(s). The sponsor is expected to provide the dictionary name and version used to map the terms.

tr.td: AdverseEvent.resultingCondition.code
Sponsors will populate this through the coding process and is applicable to items using MedDRA coding.

span.title: An indication whether any other actions were taken in response to the AdverseEvent that were unrelated to study treatment dose changes or other non-study treatments given because of this AdverseEvent.
Does not map to an SDTMIG variable. The SDTM aCRF is annotated to indicate that the field is NOT SUBMITTED.

tr.td: AdverseEvent.extension
R5 pre-adoption extension. Note that mitigatingActions also include treatments, so codes would need to be examined to only map those that were NOT treatments
